data.text: And Job further continued and said in his parable,
As God lives, who has thus judged me;
Verily, while my breath is yet in me,
My lips shall not speak evil words,
Far be it from me that I should justify you till I die;
But keeping fast to my righteousness I will by no means let it go:
Nay rather, but let mine enemies be as the overthrow of the ungodly,
For what is the hope of the ungodly, that he holds to it?
Will God hear his prayer?
Has he any confidence before him?
Yet now I will tell you what is in the hand of the Lord:
Behold, ye all know that ye are adding vanity to vanity.
This is the portion of an ungodly man from the Lord,
And if their children be many, they shall be for slaughter:
And they that survive of him shall utterly perish,
Even if he should gather silver as earth,
All these things shall the righteous gain,
And his house is gone like moths, and like a spiderâ€™s web.
The rich man shall lie down, and shall not continue:
Pains have come upon him as water,
And a burning wind shall catch him, and he shall depart,
And God shall cast trouble upon him, and not spare:
He shall cause men to clap their hands against them,
